subject: Art
title: Analogous Colors
description: Neighboring colors on the wheel ‚Äî natural harmony and unity.

hook.text: Autumn leaves: red, red-orange, orange, yellow-orange, yellow. All neighbors on the color wheel. They look effortlessly beautiful together because they share underlying hues.

buildup.text: Analogous colors: 3-5 colors sitting next to each other on the wheel. They share a common hue, which creates automatic harmony. Think ocean: blue, blue-green, green.

discovery.text: The key to a good analogous scheme: choose one dominant color, one supporting color, and one accent. Without this hierarchy, the scheme feels monotonous and flat.

twist.text: Analogous schemes are harmonious but can lack contrast. To add punch, include a small pop of the complementary color ‚Äî a tiny warm accent in a cool analogous painting, for instance.

climax.text: Nature is full of analogous color: sunsets (yellow to red), forests (yellow-green to blue-green), ocean depths (blue to blue-violet). Study nature's palettes ‚Äî they're effortlessly analogous.

punchline.text: Neighbors get along. Analogous colors are the friendly palette.

quiz.question: What makes analogous colors harmonious?
options: They are opposite on the wheel
They sit next to each other and share a common hue
They are all the same color
